Research and Teaching in Computer Science. My Research Lab http://demo.cs.brandeis.edu focuses on the principles of self-organization of complex co-evolving systems, and is best known for the GOLEM project where robots designed and manufactured other robots. http://Beeweb.org is a new application which uses co-evolution principle to drive P2P multiplayer gaming for basic education.

Thinmail is a scaleable and reliable platform which solves the attachment problem by turning files into private hyperlinks which can be remotely controlled with short messages. It resides between the digital and analog communications network as an "en route" service. Thinfax can print documents to any fax machine. Thinphone can deliver audio and text-to-speech to any telephone.

The telephone did not take off until it incorporated Edison's carbon microphone lowering the energy requirement enabling 20 mile links.  Wireless messaging will not take off until it includes a low-cost solution to the attachment problem.

I am Chair of the Computational Linguistics MA Program, Chair of the Linguistics and Language Program, and Director of the Lab for Linguistics and  Computation. My lab does research in computational semantics, machine learning, lexical semantics, corpus creation and annotations, temporal and spatial reasoning, and generative lexicon.
